page.title: 04Travel in the area.
page.content: The area is well served with public transport networks in the form of the Wandle District of London Transport and British Rail. The area is criss-crossed by bus routes into Sutton, Morden, Croydon, Banstead, Wallington, Kingston and Wimbledon amongst other places. They help to keep links with British Rail and other areas in this essentially commuter zone of South West London. British Rail has direct lines to London Bridge, Victoria, and Waterloo via Wimbledon. Many people in the area own cars and use this as their main form of transport.Many also had bicycles but were not keen on riding them on the roads in this area because of traffic congestion and atmospheric pollution.
